snippet: Authorities are responding to current and former JPMorgan financial advisers who said they had felt pressure to sell the bank's products even when cheaper or better performing options were available.
abstract: Authorities are responding to current and former JPMorgan financial advisers who said they had felt pressure to sell the bank's products even when cheaper or better performing options were available.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

headline.main: Many Regulators Put Their Attention on How JPMorgan Marketed Its Funds
headline.print_headline: Many Regulators Put Their Attention On How JPMorgan Promoted Funds
